Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Physical Activity Intervention in Colorectal Cancer Surgery

Participants.evidence: Participants aged ≥20 years scheduled for elective colorectal cancer surgery were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention included aerobic activity and inspiratory muscle training 2 weeks preoperatively and 4 weeks postoperatively.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effect of a short-term, unsupervised exercise intervention on self-assessed physical recovery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was self-assessed physical recovery 4 weeks postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 668 participants (intervention: 317, control: 351) were analysed using intention-to-treat.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention showed no effect on the primary outcome (adjusted odds ratio 0.84, 95% CI 0.62–1.15).
